item.title: Ticket #5845 (Monospace option when visual editor is disabled) updated
item.dc:creator: demetris
item.description:
Thanks!

I saw that ticket before posting, but I think it is different; what I refer to is the POST editor in: wp-admin/post-new.php

I was able to change its font to monospace by editing: wp-admin/css/global.css (this in WP 2.5)

I find it inconvenient to use a non-visual, plain-text editor with a proportional font, but, if there is no demand for a change, I guess it makes sense to leave it as it is. :-)

btw, the visual mode of the editor does not seem to be affected by the change in wp-admin/css/global.css -- but I don't know what else may have been affected...

Thanks again, Demetris

item.title: Ticket #5844 (remove extra <ul> in walker class) created
item.dc:creator: hailin
item.description:
As reported by James R Whitehead of interconnectit.com on wp-hackers:

I'm wondering why the html generated by wp_list_pages and wp_list_categories has changed in the current 2.4-bleeding. I know things in this are not set in stone so I'm hoping it's not a permanent change as it makes coding CSS menus that work with 2.3 and 2.4 very difficult especially as child item are no longer in a single container. The new structure also makes less sense semantically as each child is now a separate UL.

Changed from:

<ul>

<li>

Text <ul>

<li>text</li> <li>text</li> <li>text</li>

<ul>

</li>

</ul>

To:

<ul>

<li>

Text <ul>

<li>text</li>

<ul> <ul>

<li>text</li>

<ul> <ul>

<li>text</li>

<ul>

</li>

</ul>

item.title: Ticket #5838 (Make Nonce Mismatch Fail Instead of AYS) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
A possible alternative would be to still show the AYS screen, not update the nonce, but require the user to enter his or her password (or username and password) to authenticate the request.

Pros: keeps the insurance we already have of not losing a POST request because of failed/expired nonce. That's a rare event. I think every time I've gotten an AYS it was because of bad code, not an expired nonce, so resubmitting by clicking yes didn't work anyway.

Cons: harder to code, needs to be audited, breaks the "deny, don't fix" security philosophy, is still open to social engineering CSRF if a user uses the same username/password pair on many sites. Such a CSRF attack could use a form like the following using similar techniques to the one above. 

 Sign up for the new hotness!
 username ____
 password ____

... submit... Attack successful: those fields were actually the nonce AYS username/password fields. The user put their "tried and true" username/password pair into them.

Unrelatedly, a plugin can be written to fix this security issue. Just replace check_admin_referer() (it's pluggable).

item.title: 233_nonce_fix.diff attached to Ticket #5838

item.title: Ticket #5841 (Semantic changes to wp_list_pages and wp_list_categories) created
item.dc:creator: hyperionjrw
item.description:
The walker function is adding too many ULs to child pages and categories in wp_list_pages and wp_list_categories. This is wrong semantically and will break old themes that have CSS powered drop-down menus and other such things.

Line 420 and 445 in the walker class of classes.php (both read "if ($depth > 0)")need to check that the depth has changed from the previous run through. However this may be problematic for page drop-down versions.

The 2.3 version of wp_list_pages produces:

<ul>
<li>
Text
<ul>
<li>text</li>
<li>text</li>
<li>text</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

Current 2.4-bleeding version:

<ul>
<li>
Text
<ul>
<li>text</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li>text</li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li>text</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

item.title: Ticket #5840 (LJ import does not translate lj user= tags) created
item.dc:creator: novalis_dt
item.description: Livejournal allows you to link to other users by creating a tag [lj user="fleem"], where [] are angle brackets, and fleem is the username you're linking to. The present LJ importer leaves this untranslated, resulting in posts that appear to be missing all usernames. Patch attached.

item.title: Ticket #5750 (New Dashboard Interface) updated
item.dc:creator: _ck_
item.description:
By the way, I've successfully tested a method to re-order these "widgets" (divs) by applying jquery.ui.sortable to them.

It's as simple as applying a class to each widget, wrapping the main wider column on the left with one div and the sidebar with another div. Needs 3 small jquery.ui libraries.

Then you can move the widgets up and down or even from the main column to the sidebar and back.

Only thing I don't have ready is a way to save the positions, which could be done via cookies like wordpress.com or via ajax as the open/closed method is currently done in the trunk. That part's a bit harder and I wanted to wait to hear if this was interesting.

item.title: Ticket #5838 (Make Nonce Mismatch Fail Instead of AYS) created
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
As the post â€‹here points out (I've duplicated his attack using my own 2.3.3 setup), you can make a CSRF attack that tricks a WordPress user into changing the admin password and emailing it to someone, by hiding all of the nonce confirmation except the "yes" submit button.

When the nonce doesn't match, my patch lets you know that the action has failed, and it provides a link back to the referring page so that you can try again.

item.title: Ticket #1626 (user_nicename should be unique ) updated
item.dc:creator: pishmishy
item.description:
Keywords changed

We don't use the pre_user_nicename filter, just modify username_exists() to make sure another user doesn't have the same nicename. Adds a function to retrieve user data based on nicename.

I'm not entirely sure how this would effect upgrades to an installation where nice-names are already conflicting, so tagged as needs-testing and dev-feedback.

item.dc:creator: paulmjr

Replying to paulmjr:

this change is causing segmentation errors on my system, can we investigate why/and/or fix it ?

more details in: â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic/155883?replies=7

the fix for now is use script-loader.php from v 2.3

Looking at the info you have posted you have a php crash occurring.

Can you generate a backtrace for it?

â€‹http://bugs.php.net/bugs-generating-backtrace.php

I'll give that a go tonight and post the result, thanks for looking into it

item.title: Ticket #5837 (WordPress and Moveable Type import create weak password) created
item.dc:creator: pishmishy
item.description:
wp-admin/import/mt.php and wp-admin/import/wordpress.php need to do something better than creating accounts with the password "changeme". For an import with few users it's not certain that the user will change all the new passwords, for an import with large numbers of users it could be a particularly laborious task.

Suggest generating a random password with the usual algorithm. User can have the admin change the password if needed, or run through the recovery process.

item.title: Ticket #5560 (Automatic Upgrade) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Replying to darkdragon:

The current upgrade system is not up to my personal standards, which means it does not work on my system and is throwing errors. It appears that it wants to traverse all directories leading up to the public one. I take issue with that since I do not have permissions to the directories above mine. Not quite true, but in most cases I don't.

You mean the stuff for #5586? If so, yes, that needs to be fixed.

item.dc:creator: rene_e
item.description: Hi, thanks for the patch. Had the same problem, was solved with the patch. But the title shouldn't be decoded, it's not encoded in base64 (cause it's no content). So by removing the second part of the patch, it works flawlessly with Moto-EZX email client.

item.title: Ticket #5835 (No option to show all pages of a post in a feed) created
item.dc:creator: ArachneJericho
item.description:
Hello,

When my posts use <!--nextpage-->, my RSS feed will not show any pages other than the first one. I want to give my users the full feed; I currently use the full feed plugin from cavemonkey. I tried to modify his plugin to remove the <!--nextpage--> as well as the <!--more-->, but this didn't work. From the code, with refers to a global $page and a global $pages (which I'm having a hard time finding the definitions for in the code base, since I'm not familiar with it), looks like any filters cut in after the content has been chopped into pages.

Or perhaps not. I'm not sure.

Please help me. Either help me find out how to hack Wordpress, or to figure out how to cut in a filter that removes <!--nextpage--> before the post is chopped into pages, or maybe to even add an option in Wordpress officially so that all pages of a post can be placed in a feed.

Please, please, please help.

Thank you.

item.title: Ticket #5834 (Errneous variable name in comments-template.php) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
$post in line 585 should be $_post.

Looking at that, Its supposed to be $post_id, As in, You pass the post id in, then it fetches that post, and checks the ping status.

item.title: Ticket #5834 (Errneous variable name in comments-template.php) updated
item.dc:creator: reinkim
item.description: This function is located in wp-includes/comment-template.php

item.title: Ticket #5834 (Errneous variable name in comments-template.php) created
item.dc:creator: reinkim
item.description:
in [6716], 

	585 function pings_open( $post_id=NULL ) {
 	586
 	587	    $_post = get_post($post_id);
 	588
 	589	    $open = ( 'open' == $post->ping_status );
 	590	    return apply_filters( 'pings_open', $open, $post_id );

$post in line 585 should be $_post.

This variable lookup-failure causes trackback failure

item.title: Ticket #5833 (Default location for plugins configuration) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
from IRC:

DD32: my 2c would be, dont bother. Plugin authors need to choose where to put the menu's correctly, Currently the "options" menu(now settings) is a generic location for options/settings, thats where i expect the options to be. Theres exceptions for plugins that have "Design" menu's or come under the write menu and whatnot, Some authors just choose illogical places for their menu's, and that'll still continue to happen if a change was made.

item.title: Ticket #5833 (Default location for plugins configuration) created
item.dc:creator: CShadowRun
item.description:
I've noticed alot of the plugins have configuration menus, and they all seem to be randomly dotted around the administration panel. You end up having to wander around all the menus untill you can find whete a plugin dumped it's config

I suggest that you have something like a "Plugins config" tab, or maybe a Plugins Config sub tab inside the Plugins tab, or something similar. Some default place where all plugins dump the configs. I obviously am not suggesting that you force all existing plugins to be changed, that would be crazy. Just that the functionality be added, so that all future plugins would be in there, and in the end make life easier.

item.title: Ticket #5831 (Inline help for "UTF-8 is recommended" needs replacing) updated
item.dc:creator: darkdragon
item.description:
I do think that is the point, but there is probably a better resource for possible encodings. WordPress.org could also include a list of possible encodings, but since it is probably better to not have user change it, I would just remove the link entirely.

A competent user can find the correct encoding on their own, in my humble opinion.

item.title: Ticket #5832 (Write -> Post formatted badly on small screens) updated
item.dc:creator: ionfish
item.description: I must admit to being somewhat baffled by that margin too. I don't have an especially tiny monitor (1280x800), but I don't have my browser window anywhere close to maximised, so the huge gap on the right of the admin pages in WordPress squashes what's actually quite a densely packed set of functionality into a rather small space.

item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: right margin matches left (15px)

item.title: WordPress write screen - big right margin.png attached to Ticket #5832
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: current

item.title: Ticket #5832 (Write -> Post formatted badly on small screens) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Currently, we have .wrap { margin-right: 15% }. This rule makes the Write screen look bad on small monitors.

Attached are two images. One shows the current state on a 800px wide monitor, the other shows what it would look like if the right margin matched the left (15px).

Is there a minimum resolution we're going to support?

item.title: Ticket #5831 (Inline help for "UTF-8 is recommended" needs replacing) created
item.dc:creator: lloydbudd
item.description:
Inline help for "UTF-8 is recommended" needs replacing

ENV: WP trunk r6800 (2.4-bleeding)

At Settings > Reading (wp-admin/options-reading.php) the last setting is "Encoding for pages and feeds:" and below the field it reads "The character encoding you write your blog in (UTF-8 is recommended)"

Recommended links to â€‹http://developer.apple.com/documentation/macos8/TextIntlSvcs/TextEncodingConversionManager/TEC1.5/TEC.b0.html

That Apple.com page reads at the top 

Legacy Document
Important: The information in this document is obsolete and should not be used for new development.

Further, I can't see how it really helps. There is no language about recommendation there only a table of possible encodings.

item.dc:creator: betsyk
item.description: Hi there. Just wanted to add more info about this bug. Many users have reported and discussed it in the WP forums at: â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic/107583. I have outlined the troubleshooting steps required to replicate & resolve the problem on my blog at: â€‹http://www.umaitech.com/cms/?p=27.

item.title: Ticket #5830 (current_page_item CSS menu highlighting) created
item.dc:creator: betsyk
item.description:
Hi there,

This is my first time logging a bug report in Trac, so I hope I am doing this correctly. There's an ongoing issue when using Wordpress as a CMS in conjunction with navigation highlighting for menus. The problem is that Wordpress doesnâ€™t pass the "current_page_item" selector properly on the posts page, or to its associated category pages. Many users have reported and discussed this issue in the WP forums at: â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic/107583. I have outlined the troubleshooting steps required to replicate the problem on my blog at: â€‹http://www.umaitech.com/cms/?p=27. Just wanted to inform WP developers about this.

Thanks.

item.title: 5829.diff attached to Ticket #5829
item.dc:creator: henrikmelin
item.description: Patch for 5829

item.title: Ticket #5829 (Make _wp_comment_list_item filter the post's title) created
item.dc:creator: henrikmelin
item.description:
In the _wp_comment_list_item() function the post title is currently formatted using wp_specialchars. Since this has no hook it is not possible to change or format the title prior to it being displayed.

I propose that the standard formatting filter 'the_title' is applied instead, using get_the_title($post->ID), making it accessible to plugins (and formatted in the same way it is formatted everywhere else, for consistency).

This is dependent on ticket #5746. This change makes the ID available to the 'the_title' filter.

item.title: gallery-clear.diff attached to Ticket #5828
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski

item.title: Ticket #5828 (floated left gallery images break blog layout) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. Use a theme, which doesn't clear the floats after the post content (there are many of them)
  2. Upload one photo
  3. Insert [gallery] in your post
  4. Save/Publish

Current: the next section, after the photo is pulled on the left of the photo, on the same line

Expected: the next section is below the photo

Here is a patch, which adds <br style="clear: both;" /> in the end of the gallery div.

item.title: Ticket #5560 (Automatic Upgrade) updated
item.dc:creator: mastermind
item.description:
Replying to ryan:

To survey what else is available, there is also this plugin:

â€‹http://www.zirona.com/software/wordpress-instant-upgrade/

Just FYI, Instant Upgrade is available in â€‹a new version, now also with FTP support and many other features. (A first alpha with FTP support had already been released in May 2007, but this beta is really mature. I think it will be released "final" soon.)

Please also consider this plugin, when you think about inclusion of an automatic upgrading solution into the WP core.

Regardless of which one will be taken; I also (like filisofo) have concerns about taking such a complex piece of software into the WP core. I've â€‹written about this topic a while ago (Note that the security-related statements in that entry refer to the old IU version). However, if the core developers want to include one, I wouldn't mind seeing mine being taken. ;)

item.title: Ticket #5827 (different custom link in submenu profile/users) created
item.dc:creator: neoxx
item.description:
hi!

while integrating an avatar/userpic-plugin i noticed, that a custom submenu-link in the menu profile (for standard users) and users (for admins) differ. - hence, it is not possible to add a link from the profile.php page with ?page=xxx, because it points from the users and the admins view to profile.php?page=xxx which is users.php?page=xxx for admins. - any suggestions that does not mean checking the user_level and customizing the links?

cheers berny

item.title: Ticket #5826 (uploader can't handle filename with non-english characters) created
item.dc:creator: gamerhk
item.description:
When i upload a file with chinese filename (åœ–åƒ006.jpg), the file is saved as 

%e5%9c%96%e5%83%8f066.jpg

in the file system.

However, when wordpress tries to load the pic, it shows the image as 

http://mydomain/path/%e5%9c%96%e5%83%8f066.jpg

rather than 

http://mydomain/path/%25e5%259c%2596%25e5%2583%258f066.jpg

which causes a 404

item.title: Ticket #5823 (Unused text and RSS widgets lose data after 2.5 upgrade) created
item.dc:creator: bryan868
item.description:
Any text or RSS widgets that contain data and are sitting in your "unused widgets" area will be deleted when you upgrade to 2.5.

2.5 does not have ID support (Text 1, 2, 3, 4) for text or RSS widgets? This could have something to do with it.
